DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text name of an anatomic site or organ in which there is evidence of the spread of prostate cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to evidence of the spread of cancer from the prostate gland in the male reproductive system to another part of the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A gland in the male reproductive system just below the bladder. It surrounds part of the urethra, the canal that empties the bladder. It produces a fluid that forms part of semen. (NCI-GLOSS):A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: (MET-uh-STAT-ik) Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from one part of the body to another.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: revised to provide naming consistency for related elements

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Prostate carcinoma is one of the most common malignant tumors afflicting men.  The majority of carcinomas arise in the peripheral zone and a minority occur in the central or the transitional zone of the prostate gland.  Grossly, prostatic carcinomas appear as ill-defined yellow areas of discoloration in the prostate gland lobes.  Adenocarcinomas represent the overwhelming majority of prostatic carcinomas. _2002_Cancer that has spread from the organ in which it first appeared to another organ.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The cavity just below the bladder where the prostate gland is located.

Concepts.definition: The cavity just below the bladder where the prostate gland is located.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

Concepts.definition: The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.7 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any lymph node within the pelvic region.

Concepts.definition: Any lymph node within the abdominal pelvic region.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 8/12/22 added alt VM for Alliance cjl;

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Associated concept to VM for TCGA. mc 11/9/12 - reversed concept order to match the semantics of this phrase which is "other" with "specify" as a qualifier/modifier - DW 12-30-2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (PLOOR-a) A thin layer of tissue covering the lungs and the wall of the chest cavity to protect and cushion the lungs. A small amount of fluid that acts as a lubricant allows the lungs to move smoothly in the chest cavity during breathing.

Concepts.definition: The tissue that lines the wall of the thoracic cavity and the surface of the lungs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of, or relating to, or affecting the internal organs.

Concepts.definition: Of, or relating to, or affecting the internal organs.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Prostate carcinoma is one of the most common malignant tumors afflicting men.  The majority of carcinomas arise in the peripheral zone and a minority occur in the central or the transitional zone of the prostate gland.  Grossly, prostatic carcinomas appear as ill-defined yellow areas of discoloration in the prostate gland lobes.  Adenocarcinomas represent the overwhelming majority of prostatic carcinomas.  Prostatic-specific antigen (PSA) serum test is widely used as a screening test for the early detection of prostatic carcinoma.  Treatment options include radical prostatectomy, radiation therapy, androgen ablation and cryotherapy.  Watchful waiting or surveillance alone is an option for older patients with low-grade or low-stage disease.  -- 2002:Cancer that has spread from the organ in which it first appeared to another organ. For example, breast cancer cells may spread (metastasize) to the lungs and cause the growth of a new tumor. When this happens, the disease is called metastatic breast cancer.:Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: One of the most common malignant tumors afflicting men.  The majority of carcinomas arise in the peripheral zone and a minority occur in the central or the transitional zone of the prostate gland.  Grossly, prostatic carcinomas appear as ill-defined yellow areas of discoloration in the prostate gland lobes.  Adenocarcinomas represent the overwhelming majority of prostatic carcinomas.  Prostatic-specific antigen (PSA) serum test is widely used as a screening test for the early detection of prostatic carcinoma.  Treatment options include radical prostatectomy, radiation therapy, androgen ablation and cryotherapy.  Watchful waiting or surveillance alone is an option for older patients with low-grade or low-stage disease.

The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.
Named locations of or within the body.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Reassignment of Representation term concept from C37901 (site) to C13717 (anatomic site) as part of structured caDSR harmonization activity 10/10/2006.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated for Duke University clinical trial.
